page.title: 01MORPETH
page.content: BOROUGH OF CASTLE MORPETH The {castle}is now in ruins,only the gatehouse remains.It was lived in during the reign of Charles the First. {MORPETH}_means the town on the path over the moor.It was called{Morepathia by the {Romans.}It has no written history before the {Normans}came.{ {Stobhill}and{Hepscott}were also parts of the{De Merlay}barony,which was granted rights,as a market town by King John 1199. {Stobhill}is at the top of the hill. stob could mean a stump of a tree or a signpost.An old mile stone still stands near the British Legion Club.It has always been an extension of Morpeth,a place for those working in the area to live .
